site_info.title: Kaizen Karate | Traditional Martial Arts Training
site_info.description: Experience authentic karate training at Kaizen Karate. Traditional martial arts instruction for all ages and skill levels. Build discipline, confidence, and character.
site_info.keywords: karate, martial arts, traditional, training, discipline, character

hero_section.title: KAIZEN KARATE
hero_section.quote: Discipline is not about being told what to do. It is about learning how to choose what matters.
hero_section.subtitle: Kaizen Karate has offered martial arts instruction since 2003. Founded by Coach V, we specialize in karate instruction for children of all ages in the Washington DC, Maryland, Northern Virginia, and New York areas. We also offer karate programs for adults with a focus on fitness and self-defense.

summer_camp.text: Registration for Summer Camp 2026 has not opened yet.
Registration for Summer Camp 2026 has not opened yet.

cards.title: After School Program
cards.summary: Comprehensive martial arts training for students after school hours.
cards.description: Safe, structured environment where children learn traditional karate while developing discipline, respect, and confidence. Perfect for working parents.
cards.image_alt: After school karate program for children at Kaizen Karate

cards.title: Weekend & Evening
cards.summary: Flexible scheduling for adults and families with busy weekday commitments.
cards.description: Traditional karate training designed to fit your lifestyle. Weekend and evening classes accommodate work and school schedules while maintaining authentic instruction.
cards.image_alt: Weekend and evening karate classes for busy schedules

cards.title: Belt Exams
cards.summary: Test your skills and advance through traditional karate ranks.
cards.description: Belt exams are invitation-only and students must be invited by their instructor to test. Our rigorous testing ensures authentic skill development and progression.
cards.image_alt: Traditional karate belt exam process at Kaizen Karate

cards.title: Online Store
cards.summary: Equipment, uniforms, and training materials for students.
cards.description: Everything you need for your karate journey - from beginner gear to advanced equipment. Support your training with authentic, high-quality items.
cards.image_alt: Kaizen Karate online store for equipment and merchandise

kaizen_section.title: About Kaizen Karate
kaizen_section.coach_v_image_alt: Coach V - Head Instructor at Kaizen Karate
kaizen_section.lead_paragraph: Kaizen Karate was founded by Coach V in 2003. Kaizen Karate has been offering instruction in non-traditional Tang Soo Do as part of its core curriculum since its founding. Around 2010 Chinese Kenpo was introduced into the Kaizen curriculum.
kaizen_section.paragraph_2: Kaizen Karate's team of highly trained martial artists offer a number of programs for students starting as young as 3.5 years old up to adult. They focus on discipline and encouragement in a fun-loving environment. Their main goal is to help everyone progress, continually improve, and enjoy the process.
kaizen_section.paragraph_3: Kaizen Karate now operates 7 days per week throughout Maryland, Washington D.C., Virginia, and New York.

coach_v_section.title: Meet Coach V
coach_v_section.paragraph_1: "Coach V" has 38 years of experience in the martial arts, having spent the majority of his life committed to the trade. He began his journey with karate at five years old and earned his first black belt in non-traditional Tang Soo Do in 1998 through Hill's Hitters Karate and Master Instructor Dr. Phillip Hill.
coach_v_section.paragraph_2: Coach V went on to earn his business degree at the Robert H. Smith School of Business at the University of Maryland in College Park. He then continued his training in Kenpo under 8th degree black belt Sifu Greg Payne who also holds a 5th degree black belt in Shotokan as well as many other black belts in other arts including Goju ryu & Judo.
coach_v_section.paragraph_3: In 2024, Coach V was promoted to 8th degree black belt in IKCA Chinese Kenpo by 10th degree black belt Senior Grandmaster Chuck Sullivan. Additionally, Coach V holds the rank of Nikyu (2nd degree brown belt) in Budoshin JuJitsu and studied Aikido at the ASU headquarters overseen by Saotome Sensei, Shihan.
coach_v_section.paragraph_4: In his free time he enjoys spending time with his wife and children as well as running local long distance races which most recently included the Cherry Blossom 10 miler, Rock 'n' Roll 1/2 Marathon, & Marine Corp Marathon in Washington, DC.

instructors.name: Coach Chris Marr
instructors.title: Instructor
bio: Qualifications: 5th degree black belt with Kaizen Karate, over 20 years of martial arts experience and over 15 years of instructional experience.

Coach Chris holds black belts in Kenpo Karate and Tien Shan Pai Kung Fu and has trained for years in several different martial arts including: Muay Thai (reaching the rank of instructor), boxing, Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (blue belt), and Kyokushin Karate. He is very interested in the history of martial arts, especially arts from East Asia and Southeast Asia.
Chris' other hobbies include running, lifting weights, and interval training mostly to stay competitive in the martial arts he still practices. He spends most of his free time with his wife and son.

instructors.name: Coach Zach Knox
instructors.title: Instructor
bio: Experience: Training since 1987, Zach Knox holds black belts in Tae Kwon Do and Hap Ki Do.

Over the years, he has trained in different arts such as Kung Fu, Shorin Ryu and Goju Ryu Karate, Kickboxing, and Escrima. In his time away from teaching and training, his hobbies include acting, directing, producing, football, hiking, screenplay writing, reading, boxing, and rock climbing.

instructors.name: Coach David Matusow
instructors.title: Instructor
bio: Background: Inspired by 'The Karate Kid', Coach David began his martial arts journey in 1988. He currently holds a 1st degree blackbelt in Tae Kwon Do, a 6th degree blackbelt in non traditional Tang Soo Do, and a 6th degree blackbelt in Chinese Kenpo where he is also an IKCA Certified Instructor.

Coach David earned his first blackbelt in Tae Kwon Do in 1993 under 9th degree Master Jae Kim, his second blackbelt in Tang Soo Do from Kaizen Karate under Coach V, and his third blackbelt in IKCA Chinese Kenpo under Coach V and 10th degree blackbelt Senior Grandmaster Chuck Sullivan.

A Software Engineer at NASA and accomplished triathlete, Coach David has competed in numerous races and is a 3-time Ironman triathlon finisher. He has 2 children, both blackbelts in Kaizen Karate, and enjoys competing in duplicate bridge and home coffee brewing.

instructors.name: Coach Skylar Parr
instructors.title: Instructor
bio: Journey: Coach Skylar started martial arts at 11 years old. After bouncing around a few schools at first, she eventually landed in a Tae Kwon Do dojang, where she would get the base of her skills and passion for the arts.

She began training and teaching with Kaizen Karate in 2011 and earned her black belt in 2017. As an avid martial artist and personal trainer (NASM), she spends most of her time doing things related to fitness and martial arts. However, she also loves studying languages, playing drums, camping, skateboarding, and learning about a wide breadth of subjects.

instructors.name: Coach Nina Hanisco
instructors.title: Instructor
bio: Experience: Coach Nina has trained with Kaizen Karate for over 10 years and has over five years of teaching experience in summer camp and classes. She is a Kaizen Karate Senior Instructor.
She received her Kaizen Karate black belt in 2021 and her first degree Kaizen black belt in 2023. Currently, she studies Psychology and Sociology at McDaniel College in Westminster, Maryland.

instructors.name: Coach James Stevens
instructors.title: Instructor
bio: Unique Journey: Coach James' exploration of martial arts began as a Kaizen Karate parent, watching his now-advanced rank son throw punches and kicks as a kindergartner. Starting as a virtual student in spring 2020, he dedicated himself to training with accelerated progress.

When he began in-person classes in 2021, his progress continued at an accelerated pace, earning him many tournament victories, additional ranking in Chinese Kenpo, and opportunities to share lessons learned throughout his unique journey.

Professionally, he works as a full-time musician, playing live shows and performing studio vocals (his rock band Rome In A Day toured the world for Armed Forces Entertainment). He enjoys reading, writing, designing tabletop games, running, basketball, lifting weights, and helping guide his daughter in her own martial arts journey.

accordion_sections.title: Daily Schedule
accordion_sections.content:
CAMP HOURS

Before care: 7:30am-9:00am

Camp day: 9:00am – 3:00pm

After care: 3:00pm-6:00pm

Karate Lesson Schedule (Daily - Non-Pool Days)

Morning Session: 9:30am-11:00am

Afternoon Session: 2:00pm-3:00pm

Aftercare Session: 4:00pm-5:00pm

*Non-karate activities include structured outdoor playtime as well as indoor playtime.

DROP-OFF / PICK-UP POLICIES

7:30am-9:00am - Parents must sign in when dropping off their child. Sign in is now touchless and camp staff will checkin students via mobile device.

3:00pm – Visitors, including parents, are not permitted inside the camp building(s). Kaizen Karate staff will guide campers safely to their authorized pick-up.

3:00pm-6:00pm – After care begins. Students must be registered for after care online or parents can pay by calling into the main office at 301-938-2711 if after care is needed unexpectedly due to traffic or other unforeseen circumstances. Students who register before March 31st receive free before and after care and MUST sign up online for the service.

If someone other than the parent will be picking-up their child we must be notified in advance by email, otherwise, we will not let the child go until a parent is contacted. Please email our office at coach.v@kaizenkaratemd.com with at least 24hrs notice of any pick-up changes.

IMPORTANT FEES & POLICIES

If your child is not picked up by 3:15pm, a flat fee of $20 will be charged for extended care for that day only (this policy will ONLY apply to campers who are not enrolled in childcare). This fee will be automatically billed and you will receive an electronic invoice. No checks are accepted.

EARLY DROP-OFFS - Students who arrive prior to 8:50am will be charged the full $20 fee for before care each day this occurs.

DAILY SCHEDULE

For full day campers doors open at 9:00am – campers should be picked up at 3:00pm

Before care starts at 7:30am and ends at 9:00am. After care starts at 3:00pm and ends at 6:00pm.

Full day campers should arrive at camp around 9:00am so they do not miss karate classes or other activities that start at 9:30am.

Walkers and bikers must have written permission from their parents before we will let them leave.

accordion_sections.title: FAQ's
accordion_sections.content:
What should I bring to camp each day?

  • Water Bottle - please label your water bottle
    *make sure to drink plenty of water at home before arriving at camp & make sure to drink plenty of water at home in the evening after camp to stay hydrated*
  • Sunscreen - Kaizen Karate staff does not apply sunscreen to campers
  • Sunglasses
  • Lunch - no access to refrigeration or microwaves
  • Hat
  • Comfortable walking shoes
  • Karate Gear – uniform and sparring gear (yellow belt and up). Please make sure your child's name is clearly labeled on all items.
  • Swimsuit, towel, and other pool items - Please make sure your child's name is clearly labeled on all items. Change of clothes needed for after swimming.
    More direction on swimming time will be posted as we get closer to the start of camp per local guidelines.
  • Nutritious Snack(s) – 1 for before lunch / 1 for after care
    (Camp does not provide snack due to potential food allergies that are common amongst campers)

What should I wear to camp each day?

Each day campers should come dressed in shorts, t-shirt & sneakers (especially if the weather is very hot). No flip-flops or open-toed shoes! Flip-flops or sandals are permitted during pool time.

Each day campers will need to bring their uniform pants, t-shirt, belt & any other items needed for their karate classes. Students who are new to karate will have the option of ordering a uniform and sparring gear if desired.

PLEASE LABEL ALL ITEMS WITH STUDENTS FULL NAME.

What NOT to bring to camp each day?

  • Weapons - pocket knives, swords or other martial arts weapons
  • Large amounts of money - we ask that campers limit the amount of money they carry to a minimum
  • Video games – or other hand held devices
  • No electronics – no electronics or other valuable items
  • Cell phones - we ask that all cell phones are put away at all times. Students are permitted to call parents if needed.

Does my child need to have karate experience to attend camp?

No, we welcome campers who do not have karate experience. Campers are separated into groups based on age and skill level.

How are the children transported to the pool?

We transport the kids from the camp to the pool with the professional bus service we provide.

More direction on transportation will be posted as we get closer to the start of camp per local guidelines.

Do campers need to know how to swim?

No, there are multiple sections of the pool. A wading pool, the shallow end, the medium area, and the deep end. All kids have to take a swim test before we release them for free swim. Depending on how well they do on the test, they will receive a colored wrist band that represents which areas they're allowed to swim in. If a child is too short for the shallow end they can use the wading pool.

Please contact our office if you would like more details about swimming procedures and safety rules.

More direction on swimming time will be posted as we get closer to the start of camp per local guidelines.

Are swim lessons provided?

There are no swimming lessons provided.

accordion_sections.title: Lunch & Snacks
accordion_sections.content:
Lunches & Snacks

Campers will provide their own lunches & beverages.

PLEASE LABEL LUNCH BOXES

Due to severe food allergies, we ask that NO PEANUT BUTTER or NUT PRODUCTS be brought to camp in lunches.

accordion_sections.title: Swimming
accordion_sections.content:
General Rules

*If your child is unable to swim and is not water-safe, please let us know in writing by emailing our main office.

*Flotation devices of any kind are not permitted. Students must be able to swim unassisted.

*Swim tests are administered at the start of every pool visit.

*Swimming pool visits are mandatory on the days they are scheduled and all campers must attend (remaining at camp is not an option).

Swimming – NW DC Camp & Silver Spring Camp

accordion_sections.title: Policies
accordion_sections.content:
Tuition Payment

Tuition for any week of summer camp must be paid in full prior to attending camp for that given week.

A non-refundable deposit of $299 per camper must be paid to hold your space in the camp for weeks that are paid via payment plan. This deposit will be applied to the total balance due.

All registration must be completed online.

NO CHECKS are accepted. All payments must be made online with credit cards during the registration process.

NO drop-ins are available. Students must pre-register for each week of camp prior to the start of the week.

*Updated on January 2nd, 2025

Behavior Policy

Safety is our number one priority. Campers are expected to follow all camp rules at all times. If the camp director determines that a camper's behavior is unsafe and a significant risk to other campers and / or staff, Kaizen Karate reserves the right to remove the camper from camp and cancel their remaining weeks of camp without a refund.

*Updated on April 11th, 2023

Illness & Make-ups

If a camper misses camp for more than 2 consecutive days due to illness then credit will be given for the days missed after the first two days when requested in writing and accompanied by a doctor's note. Eg. If Monday & Tuesday are missed, then credit is given for the remainder of the week (3 days).

If a student misses camp for any reason besides illness they can make-up the day IF there is space in another week of camp. Parents must submit an email request to our camp office to get approval. If there is no space then there will be no make-ups permitted and credit cannot be transferred to school year programs (the credit is lost).

Sick Policy

Safety and health are our #1 concern. Consequently, we reserve the right to send your child home – or refuse admittance – if we have concerns about his/her health or ability to participate in all activities. Please keep your child home if he/she is exhibiting any of the following:

  • red, runny, and/or watery eyes, he/she may have conjunctivitis (pink eye)
  • very itchy scalp with pearly white or grayish flakes that stick to hair shafts (rather than flaking off – like dandruff)
  • fever of 101 degrees internally or 100 degrees axillary. The camper may return to camp when he/she has been fever-free for a minimum of 24 hours without the aid of medication
  • vomits or has three episodes of diarrhea or watery bowel movements
  • chest is congested and is accompanied by a frequent cough

If you are ever in doubt about your child's symptoms or illness, please call the camp at 301-938-2711 and email coach.v@kaizenkaratemd.com and ask us if we feel that it would be appropriate for your child to come to school. We may require that you also consult your physician.

Cancellation Policies

Canceling a week

March 15 - April 30: All fees paid are refunded except the $299 non-refundable deposit and $25 administrative fee.

May 1 - May 31: All fees paid are refunded except the $299 non-refundable deposit and $25 administrative fee.

After June 1: There will be NO refunds or credits for summer camp weeks after June 1. NO EXCEPTIONS.

Canceling A Day

Refunds or credits for single days of summer camp will not be provided at any time. No Exceptions. Summer camp registrations are paid for on a weekly tuition fee schedule not a daily tuition fee schedule.

Canceling entire summer registration (multiple weeks)

March 15 - April 30: All fees paid are refunded except the $299 non-refundable deposit and $25 administrative fee.

May 1 - May 31: Only 50% of tuition fees will be credited for any Kaizen Karate program minus the $299 non-refundable deposit.

After June 1: There will be NO refunds or credits for summer camp weeks after June 1. NO EXCEPTIONS.

Additional Policies

Switching Weeks

Switching between weeks is allowed, based on availability.

If a camper needs to switch weeks and there is no availability then they must either keep their assigned weeks OR they can follow the cancellation policy listed above to cancel weeks based on dates (eg. After June 1 there are no refunds or credits for a camper who wants to switch weeks but there is no availability).

Adding Weeks
SPECIAL OFFER

ALL students who register prior to March 31st, 2025 will receive FREE Before & After Care.

Offer valid only for weeks purchased during the promotional period (1/14/25 - 3/31/25).

Any additional weeks purchased / added to existing reservations after the promotional period (3/31/25) will *not* be eligible for FREE before & after care.

Virtual Camp (applicable on years when Virtual offerings are available)

No transfers allowed from In-person camp to Virtual or vice versa.

There is no pro-rating at any time for virtual camp. Full tuition rate is due if you join after the start of a week.

No refunds or credits will be given after the first class of the week has started.

Late pick-up Policy @ Summer Camp

Counselors frequently have other commitments shortly after camp ends, we ask that you respect the counselor's time by arriving on time. There will be a 5 minute grace period after the program has ended. After that, parents will be charged an additional fee of $1.00 per minute. The late fee must be paid before the next camp day by contacting our main office and paying through electronic invoice.

Health & Safety Policies

Measles Policy

All campers and persons who enter a Kaizen Karate camp site must be vaccinated for measles & must be in compliance with the CDC recommendations.

Modifications Policy - Acts beyond Kaizen Karate's control

Parents agree that in the event of any failure, delay, or modification in Kaizen Karate's performance or delivery of Summer Camp programming resulting from causes beyond Kaizen Karate's reasonable control and occurring without its fault or negligence, including without limitation, Acts of God, fire, pandemic, U.S. government restrictions, wars, and insurrections, the tuition obligations under the enrollment contract shall continue and Kaizen Karate shall not be liable for any such failure or delay in its performance. Parents understand that summer camp schedules may be altered due to circumstances outside of our control resulting in on-site camp moving online and thus campers moving to Virtual Camp.

hero.title: KAIZEN DOJO
hero.description: Kaizen Dojo is an after school program operated by Kaizen Karate. We are located at 9545 Georgia Ave, Silver Spring, MD 20910 (near the beltway exits). Students will take part in daily karate lessons, snack time, homework time, and more! We provide service throughout the entire 2025-2026 school year. Please note, we follow the MCPS calendar. Service will be provided on 1/2 days.

service_cards.title: Snack Time

security_safety.title: Security, Discipline and Safety
security_safety.content:
Creating a safe, protected, and respectful environment for all children and staff.

Our Safety Commitment

The goal of our program is to create an environment where children and staff feel safe, protected, and respected.

Program Rules & Expectations

The following rules will be followed by all participants:

  • • Follow all rules set forth by Kaizen Karate
  • • Follow directions given by staff
  • • Respect the rights, privacy, and personal space of others
  • • Stay in assigned areas under staff supervision
  • • Show respect for all property and equipment
  • • Use appropriate language at all times
  • • Use the restrooms appropriately
  • • No sharing or throwing food
  • • Clean up after eating and throw away trash
  • • No fighting, bullying, or throwing harmful objects

Consequences for Rule Violations

Repeated Violations: May result in a child being suspended or no longer allowed to participate in the program.

Safety Endangerment: Behavior that endangers health and/or safety may result in immediate suspension and/or termination.

online_store.title: Online Store

hero.title: Belt Exam
hero.subtitle: Traditional Belt Testing
hero.description: Advancing through the ranks with authentic karate examination
hero.background_alt: Kaizen Karate Belt Exam - Students testing for their next rank

requirements.title: Belt exams are INVITATION ONLY events.
Online registration closes 1 week prior to the belt exam.
Verbal approvals by instructors during class time are no longer accepted.
ALL students must receive *written* approval directly from the Kaizen office team before starting the testing process.

accordions.title: Testing Process
accordions.description: Our belt testing process varies by belt level to ensure every student is properly prepared:

process_sections.title: Testing for White w/Black Stripe, Orange, or Yellow Belt

steps.title: Pre-Testing Process
steps.description: Instructor pre-tests during class time when they feel the student is ready to move up in rank. If the student is ready, the instructor will notify the Kaizen office team. Then, the Kaizen office team will email parents written approval for their child to test.

steps.title: Live Testing
steps.description: Please note: This test will be LIVE and in-person on the testing date in a group setting. If the student does not pass the in-class pre-test, they must wait until the instructor feels they are ready.

steps.title: Registration & Testing Day
steps.description: Once you have received written approval to test, then the student must register for the test by clicking the link below. Show up for your belt exam on the scheduled date.

process_sections.title: Testing for Green Belt or Higher

steps.title: Pre-Testing Process
steps.description: Instructor pre-tests during class time when they feel the student is ready to move up in rank. If the student is ready, the instructor sends written notification to the KK office team. Then, the KK office team will email the student directly with approval to test.

steps.title: Video Testing Requirements
steps.description: Once approved, students must register for the test by clicking the link below (include video links at the time of registration). Important: Sending your video as an attachment via email will NOT be accepted. Video feedback and testing results will only be sent back to the student after they have registered online using the link below.

steps.title: Important Notes
steps.description: *Please note: The video test for green belts and higher is now the actual test and is pass / fail. *After passing the video test, there is an in-person requirement for students testing for green belt and higher.

accordions.title: Requirements to Test
accordions.description: View detailed testing requirements and matrices for each belt level:

important_notice.title: Important Testing Requirements
important_notice.description: The requirements listed below are minimums. Please keep in mind that the instructor of the class may require more than what is posted.
additional_notes: *Students who train at Summer Camp only can test up to green belt rank.
*In order to test for purple belt and higher, student MUST attend weekend and / or evening classes year-round.

requirement_images.title: Testing Requirements
requirement_images.description: Detailed requirements for each belt level

requirement_images.title: Stripe System

accordions.title: Belt Exam Clothing Requirements
accordions.description: Proper uniform requirements for belt examinations by belt level:

clothing_cards.title: White Belt with Black Stripe
clothing_cards.additional_notes: Uniform must be clean and in good condition for testing.

clothing_cards.title: Orange Belt
clothing_cards.additional_notes: Orange belt should be properly tied and positioned.

clothing_cards.title: Yellow Belt
clothing_cards.additional_notes: Ensure belt is the correct shade of yellow.

clothing_cards.title: Green Belt
clothing_cards.additional_notes: Green belt represents intermediate level - maintain professional appearance.
